column4: When I try to run quake4 it says "error while loading shared libraries: libX11.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory." But /usr/lib/libX11.so.6 exists as a symlink to libX11.so.6.2.0. What's the problem and/or where else is it looking?
does that only work as root? I'd rather run as my user
no.. it should work as user.
run 'sudo chmod +r  /usr/lib/libX11.so.6', and try running it normally.
permission denied again on the LD_PRELOAD
it's a symbolic link, but I'll give you the output
I thought maybe quake4 was looking elsewhere for the file, but that location is pretty standard
this is a buddy's box; I'm trying to help him out
I'm not familiar with 64bit so this is all greek
thats the problem.. most games are 32.. i highly recoment not using 64bit ubuntu.
ah I see, I had a hunch, but no experience really. Alright, bro, thanks for the info
